text: Hackbridge railway station is a train station at Hackbridge in the London Borough of Sutton in South London. The station is served by Southern and Thameslink. It is in Fare zone 4. == Platforms == There are two platforms at this station. Platform 1 is for northbound trains to London Victoria and St Albans (via St Pancras International). Platform 2 is for southbound trains to Sutton and Epsom. == Frequency == === Up (Northbound) === * 2tph to London Victoria - Southern * 2tph to St Albans (on Sundays this service terminates at London Blackfriars) - Thameslink === Down (Southbound) === * 2tph to Epsom - Southern * 2tph to Sutton - Thameslink At peak hours, services run as far as Bedford, Luton, Dorking and Horsham. == Departures == Train Towards Calling Points Approximate Journey Time Southern (train operating company) Victoria Station Mitcham Junction, Mitcham Eastfields, Balham, Clapham Junction 27 minutes Thameslink Sutton (Surrey) Carshalton 5 minutes Thameslink St Albans Mitcham Junction, Mitcham Eastfields, Streatham, Tulse Hill, Herne Hill, Loughborough Junction, Elephant and Castle, London Blackfriars, City Thameslink, Farringdon, London St Pancras, Kentish Town, West Hampstead Thameslink, Cricklewood, Hendon, Mill Hill Broadway, Elstree & Borehamwood, Radlett 1 hour 14 minutes Southern (train operating company) Epsom Carshalton, Sutton, Cheam, Ewell East 16 minutes == Buses == London Buses route 151 serve this station. == References == == Other websites == * Hackbridge station information Category:Railway stations in London Category:1868 establishments in the United Kingdom Category:1860s establishments in England Category:Railway stations opened in 1868
